text: Colin Firth says he will never work with Woody Allen again. In a statement, he told the Guardian that he won't do any future projects with the director. The actor - who appeared in Allen's 2013 Magic in the Moonlight - is among a growing number of actors who have distanced themselves from the director in the past fortnight. Rebecca Hall, Timothee Chalamet and, reportedly, Selena Gomez have all donated their salaries from Allen's A Rainy Day In New York to the Time's Up campaign. Greta Gerwig and Ellen Page have also saidthey regret working with the film - maker.
